1.name: CMS
1.description: Content Management Systems (CMS) are platforms used to create, manage, and modify content on a website without needing specialized technical knowledge.

2.name: Message boards
2.description: Message boards or forums are online platforms where users can post and discuss topics, fostering online communities.

3.name: Database managers
3.description: Database management systems (DBMS) are software applications used to store, retrieve, and manage data.

4.name: Documentation
4.description: Documentation tools and platforms host information about products, services, or software.

5.name: Widgets
5.description: Widgets are small, self-contained applications embedded into a webpage.

6.name: Ecommerce
6.description: Ecommerce platforms provide the infrastructure to sell products and services online, managing everything from product catalogs to payments.

7.name: Photo galleries
7.description: Photo gallery platforms are used to display images on a website.

8.name: Wikis
8.description: Wikis are collaborative websites that allow users to create and edit pages.

9.name: Hosting panels
9.description: Hosting control panels are interfaces for managing web servers and hosting environments.

10.name: Analytics
10.description: Analytics tools track user behavior and provide insights into website performance.

11.name: Blogs
11.description: Blog platforms allow users to publish and manage articles and posts.

12.name: JavaScript frameworks
12.description: JavaScript frameworks are used for building dynamic web applications and user interfaces.

13.name: Issue trackers
13.description: Issue trackers are used to manage and track bugs, tasks, and features in software development.

14.name: Video players
14.description: Video players embed videos on websites.

15.name: Comment systems
15.description: Comment systems allow users to post and interact with comments on a website.

16.name: Security
16.description: Security technologies protect websites from vulnerabilities and attacks.

17.name: Font scripts
17.description: Font loading scripts control how fonts are displayed on a webpage.

18.name: Web frameworks
18.description: Web frameworks provide a structure for building web applications.

19.name: Miscellaneous
19.description: Miscellaneous tools and technologies encompass those that don't fit into other categories.

20.name: Editors
20.description: Editors are used to create and manage website content, code, and other files.

21.name: LMS
21.description: Learning Management Systems (LMS) are used to create, manage, and deliver online courses.

22.name: Web servers
22.description: Web servers are software applications that deliver web pages to users' browsers.

23.name: Caching
23.description: Caching technologies store frequently accessed data closer to the user to improve page load times.

24.name: Rich text editors
24.description: Rich text editors allow users to create and format text within a web application.

25.name: JavaScript graphics
25.description: JavaScript graphics libraries are used to create visual elements on websites.

26.name: Mobile frameworks
26.description: Mobile frameworks are used to create mobile applications and mobile-first websites.

27.name: Programming languages
27.description: Programming languages are used to build website functionalities and backend services.

28.name: Operating systems
28.description: Operating systems run web servers and infrastructure.

29.name: Search engines
29.description: Search engines embedded on websites allow users to find specific content.

30.name: Webmail
30.description: Webmail systems allow users to send and receive emails through a browser.

31.name: CDN
31.description: Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) distribute website content globally to improve load times for users.

32.name: Marketing automation
32.description: Marketing automation tools streamline marketing activities.

33.name: Web server extensions
33.description: Web server extensions enhance the capabilities of web servers.

35.name: Maps
35.description: Map technologies embed maps into websites.

36.name: Advertising
36.description: Advertising platforms display ads on websites.

37.name: Network devices
37.description: Network devices, like routers and switches, are fundamental infrastructure for the network.

38.name: Media servers
38.description: Media servers store and stream media content.

39.name: Webcams
39.description: Webcam integrations are used for video calls and similar functions.

42.name: Tag managers
42.description: Tag managers allow the addition of scripts and tracking tools to websites.

44.name: CI
44.description: Continuous Integration (CI) systems automate building, testing, and deploying code.

46.name: Remote access
46.description: Remote access technologies allow for remote administration of systems.

47.name: Development
47.description: Development tools assist in building and debugging websites and applications.

48.name: Network storage
48.description: Network storage solutions store web data and assets.

49.name: Feed readers
49.description: Feed reader technologies allow to users subscribe to content updates.

50.name: DMS
50.description: Document Management Systems (DMS) help to manage and organize documents.

51.name: Page builders
51.description: Page builders provide a visual way to design webpages.

52.name: Live chat
52.description: Live chat tools allow for real-time customer support.

53.name: CRM
53.description: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems help manage customer interactions.

54.name: SEO
54.description: Search Engine Optimization (SEO) tools help improve website ranking.

56.name: Cryptominers
56.description: Cryptominers use website visitors' resources without permission.

57.name: Static site generator
57.description: Static site generators create static HTML files.

58.name: User onboarding
58.description: User onboarding technologies guide new users.

60.name: Containers
60.description: Container technologies package applications with their dependencies.

62.name: PaaS
62.description: Platform as a Service (PaaS) provides a platform for software development.

63.name: IaaS
63.description: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) provides computing resources.

64.name: Reverse proxies
64.description: Reverse proxies intercept client requests and forward them to the appropriate server.

65.name: Load balancers
65.description: Load balancers distribute incoming traffic to multiple servers.

66.name: UI frameworks
66.description: UI frameworks provide pre-built components to build user interfaces.

67.name: Cookie compliance
67.description: Cookie compliance tools manage user consent for cookies.

68.name: Accessibility
68.description: Accessibility technologies help users with disabilities navigate websites.

69.name: Authentication
69.description: Authentication systems manage user logins and security.

70.name: SSL/TLS certificate authorities
70.description: SSL/TLS certificate authorities provide certificates used to encrypt web traffic.

71.name: Affiliate programs
71.description: Affiliate programs track marketing campaigns on websites.

72.name: Appointment scheduling
72.description: Appointment scheduling tools allow users to book appointments online.

74.name: A/B Testing
74.description: A/B testing tools help optimize website performance and user experience.

75.name: Email
75.description: Email integration technologies affect user communication.

76.name: Personalisation
76.description: Personalisation tools tailor website content based on user data.

77.name: Retargeting
77.description: Retargeting technologies display ads to users who have previously interacted with the site.

78.name: RUM
78.description: Real User Monitoring (RUM) tools track performance as experienced by users.

79.name: Geolocation
79.description: Geolocation technologies use user location data for site features.

80.name: WordPress themes
80.description: WordPress themes define the look and feel of WordPress websites.

81.name: Shopify themes
81.description: Shopify themes define the design of Shopify stores.

82.name: Drupal themes
82.description: Drupal themes dictate the appearance of Drupal websites.

83.name: Browser fingerprinting
83.description: Browser fingerprinting technologies collect information about users.

84.name: Loyalty & rewards
84.description: Loyalty and rewards programs track user engagement.

85.name: Feature management
85.description: Feature management technologies control when features are shown.

86.name: Segmentation
86.description: Segmentation tools group users based on behavior.

87.name: WordPress plugins
87.description: WordPress plugins extend functionality of WordPress websites.

88.name: Hosting
88.description: Hosting providers offer server space for websites.

89.name: Translation
89.description: Translation technologies make content accessible across languages.

91.name: Buy now pay later
91.description: Buy now pay later systems allow payment flexibility for online purchases.

92.name: Performance
92.description: Performance tools measure and optimize site speed.

93.name: Reservations & delivery
93.description: Reservation and delivery tools enable online booking and ordering.

94.name: Referral marketing
94.description: Referral programs incentivize users to promote a website.

95.name: Digital asset management
95.description: Digital Asset Management systems store and manage media files.

96.name: Content curation
96.description: Content curation systems organize content from multiple sources.

97.name: Customer data platform
97.description: Customer Data Platforms (CDPs) gather customer data from various sources.

98.name: Cart abandonment
98.description: Cart abandonment technologies track and recover abandoned shopping carts.

99.name: Shipping carriers
99.description: Shipping carrier integration provides shipping options during checkout.

100.name: Shopify apps
100.description: Shopify apps extend the functionality of Shopify stores.

101.name: Recruitment & staffing
101.description: Recruitment and staffing solutions are used for hiring processes.

102.name: Returns
102.description: Returns management technologies process product returns.

103.name: Livestreaming
103.description: Livestreaming technologies are used to broadcast real-time video content.

104.name: Ticket booking
104.description: Ticket booking systems allow users to book tickets online.

105.name: Augmented reality
105.description: Augmented reality (AR) technologies provide interactive experiences.

106.name: Cross border ecommerce
106.description: Cross border ecommerce solutions handle the complexities of selling products internationally.

107.name: Fulfilment
107.description: Fulfilment systems manage order processing and delivery.

108.name: Ecommerce frontends
108.description: Ecommerce frontends are the user interface for online stores.

109.name: Domain parking
109.description: Domain parking solutions redirect domains to a different location or page.

110.name: Form builders
110.description: Form builder technologies enable users to build forms for data collection.

111.name: Fundraising & donations
111.description: Fundraising and donation tools facilitate online charitable contributions.
